title: Great Untold Stories of World War II
description: Shrouded by wartime secrecy, these fascinating true stories of some of the most fantastic adventures of the Second World War can now be revealed: the strange case of the Japanese pilot who actually bombed America - and the American pilot haunted after twenty years by his bombing of Japan, Churchill's daring plan for a fleet of unsinkable aircraft carriers, the one-man army who terrorized an enemy island, the day germ warfare almost cost us the war, the king who went underground to defy Hitler, the rocket scientist who "ceased to exist" for four years, and other vivid, authentic experiences of GIs and generals on both sides. (from the back cover of the book)
author: Phil Hirsch
